skill.name: notebooklm
skill.description: Automate Google NotebookLM - create notebooks, add sources, generate podcasts/videos/quizzes, download artifacts. Activates on explicit /notebooklm or intent like "create a podcast about X"
skill.summary: Automate Google NotebookLM - create notebooks, add sources, generate podcasts/videos/quizzes, downlo...
skill.author: teng-lin

security_audit.summary: This is legitimate documentation for a Google NotebookLM automation tool. All static findings are false positives - the 'external_commands' are actually shell command examples in documentation, not executable code. The tool provides legitimate automation for Google NotebookLM features.

content.value_statement: Google NotebookLM is a powerful AI research tool, but lacks automation capabilities. This skill enables programmatic access to create notebooks, add sources, generate content, and download artifacts.
actual_capabilities: Create and manage NotebookLM notebooks programmatically
Add URLs, PDFs, and YouTube videos as sources
Generate podcasts, videos, quizzes, and other artifacts
Chat with documents using AI queries
Download generated content as MP3, MP4, PDF, or PNG
Perform web research and import findings
limitations: Rate limiting on audio/video generation may cause failures
Uses undocumented Google APIs that may change

use_cases.title: Turn research into engaging podcasts
use_cases.description: Upload documents and papers, then generate professional audio summaries for team sharing or personal review.

use_cases.title: Create multimedia content from sources
use_cases.description: Transform articles and documents into videos, infographics, and slide decks for social media or presentations.

use_cases.title: Generate study materials automatically
use_cases.description: Convert lecture notes and textbooks into quizzes, flashcards, and study guides for better learning outcomes.

prompt_templates.title: Create research podcast
prompt_templates.scenario: User has research papers to summarize
prompt_templates.prompt: /notebooklm Create a podcast summarizing the key findings from these research papers: [provide URLs or upload PDFs]

prompt_templates.title: Analyze documents
prompt_templates.scenario: User needs insights from multiple documents
prompt_templates.prompt: /notebooklm Create a notebook with these documents and answer: What are the main arguments and evidence presented? [provide documents]

prompt_templates.title: Generate study quiz
prompt_templates.prompt: /notebooklm Add this textbook chapter and generate a quiz to test my understanding of the key concepts

prompt_templates.title: Research automation
prompt_templates.prompt: /notebooklm Create a notebook and perform deep web research on [topic], then generate a comprehensive summary

output_examples.input: Create a podcast about AI ethics from these articles
Analyze this contract and highlight key terms
output: Key terms identified: Payment terms (Net 30), Termination clause (30-day notice), Liability cap ($1M)
Recommendations: Review indemnification section, consider adding force majeure clause

best_practices: Always authenticate first with 'notebooklm login' before starting workflows
Use explicit notebook IDs in parallel agent workflows to avoid conflicts
Wait for sources to be ready before generating content or asking questions
Use subagents for long-running operations like audio/video generation
anti_patterns: Don't rely on implicit notebook context in multi-agent scenarios
Avoid polling for status updates - use wait commands with timeouts instead
Don't attempt bulk operations without rate limiting considerations

faq.question: Why do I need to authenticate?
faq.answer: NotebookLM uses Google's OAuth to access your account and create notebooks. Run 'notebooklm login' to authenticate.

faq.question: What file types are supported?
faq.answer: PDFs, Google Docs, web URLs, YouTube videos, and plain text files. Maximum 50 sources per notebook.

faq.question: Can I use this in automated workflows?
faq.answer: Yes, set NOTEBOOKLM_AUTH_JSON environment variable with your auth data for CI/CD environments.

faq.question: What if generation fails?
faq.answer: Check artifact status with 'notebooklm artifact list', wait 5-10 minutes, then retry. Rate limiting is common.

faq.question: How do I handle multiple agents?
faq.answer: Use unique NOTEBOOKLM_HOME per agent or pass explicit notebook IDs with -n flag to avoid context conflicts.
